meanings.definition: A person of integrity and honor.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather was known as one of the kindest mensches in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The community admired him for being a true mensches.
meanings.sent3: When the mensches organized a charity event, everyone knew it would be a success.
meanings.sent4: She was the mensches of the office, always helping others without expecting anything in return.
meanings.sent5: The award was given to the most outstanding mensches of the year.

meanings.definition: Plural form of mensch, meaning a person of noble character.
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with mensches, each one contributing to the lively conversation.
meanings.sent2: In times of need, true mensches step up to help those around them.
meanings.sent3: The group of mensches decided to surprise their friend with a birthday party.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship circle was a tight-knit group of mensches, always supporting each other.
meanings.sent5: The book's main characters were portrayed as courageous mensches, standing up for what is right.
